original: HAMRIN, Johan Hjalmar, As sur ans direktör, Stockholm, f Luleå 21/12 01 av byråch J H o h h f Holmgren, gm Elsa Schussler. Eft avslut skolstud i Sthlm Schartaus 20. Prakt på grhdls- o red.kont, tjman Försäkr AB Hansa 20, bitr avd.ch 32, avd.ch 39, dir.ass 42, bitr dir 43. Sv Försäkr.frns Rubenson-stip 35 f försäkr.stud i Tyskl, föreläs Försäkr.frns kurs f försäkr.tjm sed. 33. Styr.led Sv Försäkr.frn 39, ordf ds diskuss.klb (sekt f sjöförsäkr) sed. 42, led Sjöassurad frn, styr.suppl Sv Krigsforsäkr.pool 43, ordf i Förtroenderådet i Sv Automobiltrspttariffrn 43. Resor: Span 24, Tyskl, Schweiz, Frankr, Belg, Ital 24, Tyskl 26, 29, 32, 35, 38, 39, Holl, Engl 39, Finl 37, 38, Sovjet 37. Medarb Sv Försäkr. -årsbok o tidn Assurans. Neptuniorden, Sällskapet. Hobby: Segling, resor o bridge.
translated: HAMRIN, Johan Hjalmar, Former CEO, Stockholm, born in Luleå 21/12 01, son of office clerk J.H. and housewife H.H. Holmgren, married to Elsa Schussler. After completing school studies at Schartaus in Stockholm in 1920. Worked as an apprentice at a grocery store and a publishing company, and as a clerk at the Insurance Company Hansa from 1920. Became assistant department chief in 1932, department chief in 1939, assistant director in 1942, and deputy director in 1943. Received the Rubenson scholarship from the Swedish Insurance Company in 1935 for insurance studies in Germany and lectured at the insurance course of the Swedish Insurance Company since 1933. Served on the board of the Swedish Insurance Company since 1939, became chairman of the discussion club (section for maritime insurance) in 1942, served as a member of the Sjöassurad board and deputy member of the board of the Swedish War Insurance Pool in 1943, and became chairman of the Trust Council of the Swedish Automobile Transport Tariffs in 1943. Traveled to Spain in 1924, Germany, Switzerland, France, Belgium, and Italy in 1924, Germany in 1926, 1929, 1932, 1935, 1938, and 1939, the Netherlands and England in 1939, Finland in 1937 and 1938, and the Soviet Union in 1937. Contributed to the Swedish Insurance Yearbook and the Assurance magazine. Member of the Order of Neptunus and the Society. Hobbies include sailing, traveling, and bridge.
